intro: Odontarrhena moravensis, commonly known as the Moravian toothed grass, is a perennial herb native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its flowers are small and clustered in panicles, and it is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats. Odontarrhena moravensis plays a role in maintaining ecological balance by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates.
